rationale: Computer Networks & Data Communication is crucial for students as it forms the backbone of modern communication systems. Understanding this subject is essential for comprehending how data is transferred and shared across devices and networks. It enables students to grasp the fundamentals of internet protocols, network security, and the seamless flow of information in the digital age. Proficiency in this subject is essential for various careers, ensuring students are well-equipped for the ever-evolving technology landscape. Thus, this course is an important course for students who want to work in network administration, cybersecurity, software development, and systems engineering.
competency: Utilize hardware and software technologies For the purpose of setting up, commissioning and maintaining secure computer networks.

courseOutcomes.description: Analyze the key concepts of data communication, the various physical network topologies and layered models.
Select proper transmission media and devices based on network requirements
Manage contemporary network infrastructures and configure fundamental network devices based on criteria and analyze communication protocols of hardware layer
Understanding of network security, cryptography, IP security, web security, information security standards.

practicalExercises.description: Perform and Verify Ring topology using Trainer Kit.
Introduction to Network Simulator Tool Packet Tracer Simulator.
Using Wireshark to View Network Traffic
Building Ethernet Straight and Crossover Cable
Build a Simple Two Computers Network and Verify the Connectivity in Packet Tracer Simulator.
Configure and Verify the Basic Switch Settings by using 2960 Switch.
Set Various Passwords on 1941 Router and Verify those Passwords.
Configure and Verify the Basic Router Settings by using 1941 Router.
Virtual LAN Configuration in Packet Tracer by using 2960 Switch.
Inter-virtual LAN Configuration using Legacy Inter-Virtual LAN Routing.
Inter-virtual LAN Configuration using Router on Stick Inter-Virtual LAN Routing.
Inter-virtual LAN Configuration using Multi-Layer Switch Inter-Virtual LAN Routing.
Implement Spanning Tree Protocol using Three Switches.
Implement Ether-Channel using LACP and PAGP Protocols.
Router as a Server and as a Client Configuration using DHCPv4 Protocol.

performanceIndicators.indicator: Question answer or Writing steps exercise

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.

unitOutcomes.description: Explain data communication and its significance in the field of information technology
Explain and distinguish various physical network topologies, including bus, ring, star, mesh, and hybrid configurations, and comprehend their implications for network design and performance
Define Protocol and standards
Explain the need for layer modeling
Describe the functions of each layer of OSI Reference model
Describe the functions of each layer of TCP/IP Reference model
Describe internet model
Explain concepts in Data Communication Networking

topics.title: Need, Advantages and Applications of Computer Networks
Physical topologies of Network
subtopics: Star, Ring, Bus, Mesh, Tree, Hybrid

topics.title: Internet Standards
subtopics: Protocol, Interface, Services, Primitives, semantics, syntax

topics.title: Network Classification
subtopics: Based on Transmission Technologies: Point-to-point, broadcast
Based on scale: PAN, LAN, WAN, MAN, VPN, Internet
Based on Architecture: Peer to Peer, Client Server, advantages of Client Server over Peer-to-Peer Model

topics.title: OSI and TCP/IP models and their comparison

unitOutcomes.description: Explain functions of following network devices: Repeater, Hub, Bridge, Switch Router, B-router, Gateway, Network Adapter, Access point, Wireless Access points and role of them at layer 2 and layer 3
Differentiate all network devices
Function firewall in network security
Describe a network management system with functions of OS, CLI, Administrative Functions, Interfaces
Explain and distinguish Ethernet, Fast Ethernet, Gigabit Ethernet
Explain wireless LAN
Explain FDDI & CDDI

topics.title: Classification of Transmission Media: Role of different devices

unitOutcomes.description: Explain characteristics of guided and unguided transmission media
Sketch constructional details of twisted pair, coaxial cable and fiber optic cable with labels

Explain the significance of the wireless medium as a physical layer in data communication. Discuss the key characteristics and challenges associated with using wireless communication as the physical layer
Describe ISM band and range of frequencies in it
Describe DSL technology with its types, advantages and limitations
Explain cable modem
Explain error control and flow control at data link layer in detail
Discuss error control and flow control at the data link layer
Explain HDLC, PPP, Multiple Access, CSMA, CSMA/CD and CSMA/CA
Describe and differentiate circuit switching and packet switching approach
Describe and distinguish Static and Dynamic Routing Algorithms
Explain IP addressing scheme (all types- Classless and classful) with examples
Explain CIDR. How does it differ from traditional IP address allocation methods?
Describe NAT and the different types of NAT
Explain the role of ICMP
Describe and distinguish ARP and RARP
Describe and distinguish DHCP and BOOTP
Explain how these protocols (ICMP, ARP, RARP, DHCP, BOOTP) contribute to the overall functioning of the Internet and local networks
Distinguish various components of IPv4 and IPv6 protocol
Explain different Line coding types

topics.title: Physical Layer: Transmission media
subtopics: Twisted pair, Coaxial cable, Fiber optic cable

topics.title: Physical Layer Interfaces: Types of Connectors and Signals
Sub Layers of Data Link Layer and functions
Data link protocol HDLC, PPP, Multiple Access, CSMA, CSMA/CD, CSMA/CA
Virtual circuits, and datagram, Static and Dynamic Routing Algorithms
Types IP Addressing
subtopics: gateway addressing, network and broadcast addressing, dotted decimal notation, loopback addressing

unitOutcomes.description: Explain TCP and UDP protocol in transport layer in relation to connection oriented and connection less network
Role of DNS- Domain Name System
Describe the process of DNS resolution
Explain WWW and browsers
Difference between IMAP and POP3 in the context of E-mail. Discuss SMTP protocol
Explain FTP and the difference between active and passive FTP modes and Remote Login

subtopics: connection oriented and connection less network

subtopics: Functions of E-mail system, User agent, Message format, Mail Protocols (SMTP, POP3), FTP, Remote Login

unitOutcomes.description: Key aspects related to the Copyright Act in India
Define the terms "encryption" and "decryption" in the context of cryptography
Difference between symmetric and asymmetric encryption algorithms
Explain IP security
Explain ISO standards and how it contributes to information security
Briefly describe the Information Technology (Amendment) Act, 2008, and its impact on cyber laws in India
Explain Social Issues, Hacking & Precautions

topics.title: IP security: SSH and Web security
Information Security Standards
subtopics: ISO, IT Act, Copyright Act, Cyber Laws in India

topics.title: IT Act 2000 Provisions and latest amendments

studentActivities: Prepare journals based on practical performance in the laboratory.
Students are encouraged to register themselves in various MOOCs such as: Swayam, edx, Coursera, Udemy etc to further enhance their learning

Prepare chart to represent the Network Topology Diagrams, Protocol Stack Diagrams, Flowcharts for Protocols, Error and Flow Control Graphs, Bandwidth Utilization Charts, Network Performance Metrics, Comparison Charts for Data Link Protocols, Routing Algorithm Comparison Graphs, IP Addressing Schemes, Network Security Charts, Comparison of Wireless Technologies, Network Management Tools Comparison, Data Communication Medium Comparison, Ethical Hacking Incidents etc
Explore real-world case studies of network implementations, failures, or security breaches, encouraging students to analyze and propose solutions.
To design a network in your department such as one drive can be accessible from any other system.

Prepare LAN cable and test it. (Practice cable stripping, untwisting, and proper crimping techniques, Learn about different types of LAN cables, such as Cat5e, Cat6, or Cat6a, and their applications, Create a simple diagram or documentation illustrating the cable connections.)
List different types of Network operating system.
Identify the type of Network in your Institute.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics.
Some of the topics/subtopics are relatively simple and very easy for the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.09, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students for using the latest Technical Magazine.

Show video lectures to explore various network management tools, including both graphical user interfaces (GUI) and command-line interfaces (CLI), emerging technologies, such as 5G, IoT, or SDN, and their impact on network communication with help of the internet.
Invite industry experts to deliver guest lectures on current trends, challenges, and best practices in computer networks and data communication

microProjects.title: Dynamic Cloud Network Control Under Reconfiguration Delay and Cost
microProjects.description: Design and implement a dynamic cloud network control system that manages reconfiguration delays and costs.

microProjects.title: Measuring Web Latency and Rendering Performance
microProjects.description: Develop a system to measure and analyze web latency and rendering performance metrics.

microProjects.title: Configuration to a DHCP Server
microProjects.description: Configure and implement a DHCP server for automatic IP address assignment.

microProjects.title: Implement and Verify Static Routes
microProjects.description: Implement static routing configurations and verify their functionality.

microProjects.title: Connectivity Tests with Traceroute
microProjects.description: Perform network connectivity tests using traceroute and analyze the results.

microProjects.title: Configure Dynamic NAT using Packet Tracer
microProjects.description: Configure dynamic Network Address Translation using Cisco Packet Tracer.

microProjects.title: configure Switch and Router VTY,Privilege and enable Password Assignment
microProjects.description: Configure various password levels on network switches and routers.

microProjects.title: Implement and Verify Default Routes
microProjects.description: Implement default routing configurations and verify their operation.

microProjects.title: Client-Server based Instant Messenger
microProjects.description: Develop a client-server based instant messaging application.

microProjects.title: Configure VLAN in Switch
microProjects.description: Configure Virtual LANs on network switches.

microProjects.title: Configure Web browser security settings
microProjects.description: Configure and implement web browser security settings.

microProjects.title: Case study on Demonstration of wireless network between mobile device and PC for file transfer
microProjects.description: Demonstrate wireless network connectivity for file transfer between mobile devices and PCs.

microProjects.title: Install a small wireless network using access points
microProjects.description: Install and configure a small wireless network infrastructure.

microProjects.title: Develop a small Network. (Hands on Training.)
microProjects.description: Design and develop a complete small network with hands-on implementation.

programOutcomes.description: Basic & Discipline specific knowledge: An applied knowledge of basic mathematics, science and engineering fundamentals and engineering specialization to solve the engineering problems.
Problem Analysis: Identify and analyze well defined engineering problems using codified standard methods.
Design/ Development of Solution: Design solutions for well-defined technical problems and assist with the design of systems, components or processes to meet specified needs.
Engineering Tools, Experimentation and Testing: Apply modern engineering tools and relevant techniques to conduct standard tests and measurements.
Engineering practices for Society, Environment and sustainability: Apply relevant technology in context of Society, sustainability, environment and ethical practices.
Project Management: Use engineering management principles individually, as a team member or a leader to manage projects and effectively communicate about well-defined engineering activities.
Life-long learning: Ability to analyze individual needs and engage in updating in the context of technological changes.

developmentCommittee.name: Dr. A S Pandya
